effect.name: VR360 Hemispherical to Equirectangular
effect.description: Converts a video frame with two hemispherical images to a single equirectangular frame. The plugin assumes that both hemispheres are in the frame
effect.author: Leo Sutic

parameter.name: yaw
Alignment yaw
parameter.comment:
The two fisheye cameras of a 360 camera are rarely perfectly 180 degrees apart.
These parameters adds a rotation to both lenses to correct for this.

parameter.name: pitch
Alignment pitch
parameter.comment:
The two fisheye cameras of a 360 camera are rarely perfectly 180 degrees apart.
These parameters adds a rotation to both lenses to correct for this.

parameter.name: roll
Alignment roll
parameter.comment:
The two fisheye cameras of a 360 camera are rarely perfectly 180 degrees apart.
These parameters adds a rotation to both lenses to correct for this.

parameter.name: projection
Projection
parameter.comment: The fisheye projection type. Currently only equidistant fisheyes, like the Ricoh Theta and Garmin Virb360 are supported.

parameter.name: fov
Lens FOV
parameter.comment: The field of view of a single hemisphere in degrees, expressed as a fraction of the frame width.

parameter.name: radius
Lens radius
parameter.comment: The radius of the image circle, expressed as a fraction of the frame width.

parameter.name: frontX
Front X
parameter.comment:
The image center and image orientation for the front-facing camera.
The X parameter is a fraction of the image width.

parameter.name: frontY
Front Y
parameter.comment:
The image center and image orientation for the front-facing camera.
The Y parameter a fraction of the image height.

parameter.name: frontUp
Front Up
parameter.comment:
The image center and image orientation for the front-facing camera.
Up is the "up" direction in the image, in degrees clockwise from a direction towards the frame top edge.

parameter.name: backX
Back X
parameter.comment:
The image center and image orientation for the back-facing camera.
The X parameter is a fraction of the image width..

parameter.name: backY
Back Y
parameter.comment:
The image center and image orientation for the back-facing camera.
The Y parameter a fraction of the image height.

parameter.name: backUp
Back Up
parameter.comment:
The image center and image orientation for the back-facing camera.
Up is the "up" direction in the image, in degrees clockwise from a direction towards the frame top edge.

parameter.name: nadirRadius
Nadir radius
parameter.comment:
360 cameras like the Theta have a problem with the nadir direction where, no matter what, you will have a little of the camera in the image.
This parameter "stretches" the image near nadir to cover up the missing parts.

parameter.name: nadirCorrectionStart
Nadir start
parameter.comment:
360 cameras like the Theta have a problem with the nadir direction where, no matter what, you will have a little of the camera in the image.
This parameter "stretches" the image near nadir to cover up the missing parts.

parameter.name: distortionA
Lens distortion A
parameter.comment:
Lens distortion correction parameters.
The first three parameters are the same as in Hugin.

parameter.name: distortionB
Lens distortion B
parameter.comment:
Lens distortion correction parameters.
The first three parameters are the same as in Hugin.

parameter.name: distortionC
Lens distortion C
parameter.comment:
Lens distortion correction parameters.
The first three parameters are the same as in Hugin.

parameter.name: distortionRadius
Lens distortion radius
parameter.comment:
Lens distortion correction parameters.
If you use Hugin parameters, the Radius should be set to the value of (0.5 * min(image width, image height) / image width). For a 2:1 aspect dual hemispherical image, that would be 0.25.

parameter.name: vignettingA
Lens vignetting A
parameter.comment:
Lens vignetting correction parameters.
The first four parameters are the same as in Hugin, corresponding to the Va, Vb, Vc and Vd image parameters.

parameter.name: vignettingB
Lens vignetting B
parameter.comment:
Lens vignetting correction parameters.
The first four parameters are the same as in Hugin, corresponding to the Va, Vb, Vc and Vd image parameters.

parameter.name: vignettingC
Lens vignetting C
parameter.comment:
Lens vignetting correction parameters.
The first four parameters are the same as in Hugin, corresponding to the Va, Vb, Vc and Vd image parameters.

parameter.name: vignettingD
Lens vignetting D
parameter.comment:
Lens vignetting correction parameters.
The first four parameters are the same as in Hugin, corresponding to the Va, Vb, Vc and Vd image parameters.

parameter.name: vignettingRadius
Lens vignetting radius
parameter.comment:
If you use Hugin parameters, the radius should be set to the value of (0.5 * image diagonal / image width).
For a 2:1 aspect dual hemispherical image, that would be 0.5590. Use the A parameter to scale the effect and avoid overexposing highlights

parameter.name: emorEnabled
Use sensor response parameters
parameter.comment: Switch on to use sensor response parameters (EMoR h(x))

parameter.name: emorH1
EMoR h(1)
parameter.comment:
Sensor response parameters.
The EMoR h(x) parameters are the same as Hugin's Ra - Re in the lens parameters. If you use Hugin-derived values for vignetting correction, you should also use these parameters, as Hugin's vignetting correction assumes that the sensor response has been corrected.
